name: market for beverage carton, 1 L, for juice (ambient) | beverage carton, 1 L, for juice (ambient) | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/28080/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset represents the European market for beverage carton used in juice packaging.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included. For more information, please see the exchange comments.

This dataset starts with beverage carton leaving the gate of the producing entity, ready for distribution to using entities.

This dataset includes the transport from the production site to a central distribution site for beverage carton.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for inland waterways transport of goods. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf 'Inland waterways transport > Inland waterways transport measurement - goods > Inland waterways transport measurement - goods - annual data > Transport by type of good (from 2007 onwards with NST2007) (IWW_GO_ATYGO)' (https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/databrowser/) on the 2023-07-27. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported (t) and total payload-distance (t*km) for the NST 2007 category 'GT06 - Wood and products of wood and cork (except furniture); articles of straw and plaiting materials; pulp, paper and paper products; printed matter and recorded media' in the year 2017 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of inland waterways transport for goods in this category in 2017 was 379 km. The fraction of goods transported by rail (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 0.6% in 2017. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by inland waterways in 2017 was 2.4 km. This value was then scaled by the wet mass of the reference product. The value is assumed to be representative for Europe.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for railway transport of goods. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf 'Railway transport > Railway transport measurement - goods > Goods transported by group of goods - from 2008 onwards based on NST 2007 (RAIL_GO_GRPGOOD)' (https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/databrowser/) on the 2023-07-27. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported (t) and total payload-distance (t*km) for the NST 2007 category 'GT06 - Wood and products of wood and cork (except furniture); articles of straw and plaiting materials; pulp, paper and paper products; printed matter and recorded media' in the year 2017 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of railway transport for goods in this category in 2017 was 311 km. The fraction of goods transported by rail (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 8.2% in 2017. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by rail in 2017 was 25 km. This value was then scaled by the wet mass of the reference product. The value is assumed to be representative for Europe.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on eurostat transport statistics for road freight transport. The transport data was extracted from the database leaf 'Road transport > Road freight transport measurement > Total road freight transport > Road freight transport by type of goods and type of transport (t, tkm) - annual data (ROAD_GO_TA_TG)' (https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/databrowser/) on 2023-07-27. The transport distance was calculated based on the total mass of goods transported (t) and total payload-distance (t*km) for the NST 2007 category 'GT06 - Wood and products of wood and cork (except furniture); articles of straw and plaiting materials; pulp, paper and paper products; printed matter and recorded media' in the year 2017 for all countries for which data was available. The average distance of road transport for goods in this category in 2016 was 205 km. The fraction of goods transported by road (in terms of mass) relative to the total mass of goods transported by road, rail and inland waterways was 91.2% in 2016. Therefore, the average distance that goods travelled by road in 2016 was 187 km. This value is assumed to be representative for Europe.
